metadata.feature_description: Analytics dashboard for blog content including post views, comments, and engagement

steps.action: Navigate to PersonaBar > Dashboard > Community Analytics
steps.expected: Community Analytics dashboard loads with module tabs visible
steps.actual: Community Analytics dashboard loaded successfully showing tabs for Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki

steps.action: Click on Blogs tab to view blog-specific analytics
steps.expected: Blogs analytics section displays with blog post statistics
steps.actual: Blogs tab selected, showing Community Health metrics specific to blogs: 'Blogs older than 6 hours with no Views', 'Blogs older than 24 hours without Comments', 'Blogs with more than 2 deleted comments', etc.

steps.action: View Creates & Views section for blog statistics
steps.expected: Creates and Views metrics displayed with chart
steps.actual: Creates & Views section visible showing CREATES: 0 and VIEWS: 0 with daily chart (SAT-FRI)

steps.action: View Community Health metrics related to comments
steps.actual: Blogs tab shows comment-specific metrics: 'Blogs older than 24 hours without Comments' (0%), 'Blogs with more than 2 deleted comments' (0%)

steps.action: Verify Engagement section shows interaction metrics
steps.actual: Engagement section visible with metrics: Interacted (0), Formed Relationship (0), Shared (0), and Engagement percentage (0%)

steps.action: View Creates & Views section for author activity
steps.expected: Blog creation metrics displayed showing author activity
steps.actual: Creates & Views section displays CREATES: 0 with a weekly chart showing blog creation activity by day (SAT through FRI)

steps.action: Verify edit-related metrics for author activity
steps.expected: Metrics about blog edits/publishing activity visible
steps.actual: Community Health shows 'Blogs with more than 1 edit within 24 hours of publishing' (0%) metric tracking author editing activity

steps.action: Scroll to Popular Content section in Blogs analytics
steps.expected: Popular Content section displays popular blog posts or empty state message
steps.actual: Popular Content section visible with message 'No popular content available in selected period' indicating the feature works but no data exists for the current time period

steps.action: Verify all blog-specific Community Health metrics are displayed
steps.expected: Blog-specific metrics different from other modules displayed
steps.actual: Five blog-specific metrics confirmed: (1) Blogs older than 6 hours with no Views, (2) Blogs older than 24 hours without Comments, (3) Blogs with more than 2 deleted comments, (4) Blogs with more than 1 edit within 24 hours of publishing, (5) Blogs older than 12 hours with Views but no Interaction

steps.action: Verify Trending Tags section for blogs
steps.expected: Trending Tags section displays blog-specific tags
steps.actual: Trending Tags section visible with message 'No trending tags available in selected period'

steps.action: Open Comparative Term dropdown and change time period
steps.expected: Dropdown allows selecting different comparison periods (1 year, 1 month, 1 week)
steps.actual: Comparative Term dropdown opened successfully showing options: 1 y (year), 1 m (month), 1 w (week). Changed selection from 1 w to 1 m successfully.

steps.action: Verify date range selector is visible
steps.expected: Date range picker allows selecting custom date ranges
steps.actual: Date range selector visible showing '21 Feb 2026 - 27 Feb 2026' with calendar icon for date selection

observations: The Blogs Module Analytics feature is fully functional and displays blog-specific metrics distinct from other module types
All data values show 0% which is expected in a test environment with no blog activity data
The UI correctly shows empty state messages for Trending Tags and Popular Content when no data exists
Comparative Term dropdown allows comparing metrics across different time periods (1 year, 1 month, 1 week)
Export button is visible for exporting blog analytics data
The analytics dashboard uses a carousel-style interface showing all community modules (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki) with navigation tabs
